title: Russia sets out punitive terms at peace talks with Ukraine
CNN parts ways with correspondent months after his story cost network millions in defamation suit
Suspect in Colorado fire attack planned for a year, FBI says
description: Officials say the suspect wanted to target Zionists and researched Molotov cocktails online.

title: Russia and Ukraine fail again to agree ceasefire but commit to prisoner swap
description: The two warring sides remain far apart on how to end the conflict after a second round of talks in Turkey.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: In China, 'The Great American' burger is now made with Australian beef
description: But the 90-day tariff pause agreed by China and the U.S. in Geneva in May is now under threat as both sides have accused each other of breaching the terms.

title: Steel stocks surge after Trump doubles steel tariffs, Cleveland Cliffs jumps more than 20%
description: Trump announced at a Pennsylvania rally on Friday that he plans to double tariffs on steel imports to 50% from 25%.

title: Mongolia PM Resigns After Losing Confidence Vote
description: Mongolian Prime Minister Luvsannamsrain Oyun-Erdene resigned on Tuesday, a parliamentary statement said, after losing a confidence vote among lawmakers.

title: "Very Personal" For Me: Usha Vance On India-US Ties
description: US Second Lady Usha Vance termed the India-US relationship as one that is "very personal" for her, underlining that this is a time of "great opportunity" for ties between the two nations whose relationship has "ebbed and flowed at times".

title: Gaza Cease-Fire Negotiations Hit A New Impasse Over An Old Dispute
description: For 18 months, Hamas has pushed for a permanent truce while Israel has held out for a temporary one. That wide gap has stymied efforts to end the war.
author: Patrick Kingsley

title: South Korea’s New President Will Lead A Country More Divided Than Ever
description: The next president will face daunting challenges to heal a polarized nation and bring stability after months of political turmoil.
author: Choe Sang-Hun

title: Boulder attack suspect charged with federal hate crime, said he 'wanted to kill all Zionist people': Court documents - ABC News
description: Boulder attack suspect charged with federal hate crime, said he 'wanted to kill all Zionist people': Court documents  ABC NewsColorado Attack That Injured 12 Was Planned for a Year, Officials Say: Live Updates  The New York TimesWatch: How the Boulder attack unfolded using Molotov cocktails  BBC'USAID' paperwork found in car of Boulder terror attack suspect targeting pro-Israel group  Fox NewsSuspect posed as a gardener in Boulder attack and planned to kill all in group he called 'Zionist'  AP News

title: Inside Ukraine’s audacious drone attack on Russian air bases - CNN
description: Inside Ukraine’s audacious drone attack on Russian air bases  CNNUkraine’s Stunning Assault Roils Russia’s Global Military Strategy  WSJUkraine's drone attack on Russian warplanes was a serious blow to the Kremlin's strategic arsenal  AP NewsUkraine’s Warning to the World’s Other Military Forces  The AtlanticUkraine targets Russian airfields in multiple drone strikes  Financial Times

title: Al-Qaida affiliate attacks Mali army bases as junta struggles to contain jihadist threat
description: Attack in Timbuktu comes as Islamist group JNIM claims separate assault near border with Burkina FasoAn al-Qaida-linked group has launched an assault on a Malian army base in Timbuktu, according to military sources and local officials, a day after it claimed responsibility for another attack near the border with Burkina Faso.“The terrorists arrived today in Timbuktu with a vehicle packed with explosives,” a local official told Agence France-Presse. “The vehicle exploded near the [military] camp. Shooting is currently continuing.” Continue reading...
author: Eromo Egbejule West Africa correspondent

title: Inquest into notorious apartheid-era killings opens in South Africa
description: ‘We want to correct the historic record’ – families of the Cradock Four, beaten and killed in 1985, seek justice 40 years onAn inquest has opened into one of the most notorious killings of South Africa’s apartheid era, with a former general denying he ordered the deaths of four men who became known as the Cradock Four.Fort Calata, Matthew Goniwe, Sicelo Mhlauli and Sparrow Mkonto were stopped at a roadblock on 27 June 1985 by security officers and beaten, strangled with telephone wire, stabbed and shot to death. Continue reading...
author: Rachel Savage Southern Africa correspondent

title: Colorado firebomb suspect planned attack on pro-Israeli protesters for a year, says official
description: Mohammed Sabry Soliman, an Egyptian national, faces federal hate crime charges for allegedly attacking pro-Israeli protesters in Colorado. He reportedly planned the attack for a year, using Molotov cocktails and gasoline, injuring twelve. Soliman expressed no remorse and desired the victims' deaths.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Was Michael Wolff's claim about Harvard University rejecting Donald Trump correct? Here's what US President said
description: Donald Trump refuted Michael Wolff's assertion that he was denied admission to Harvard University, labeling Wolff a "third-rate reporter." Trump stated he never applied to Harvard, having graduated from the Wharton School of Finance. Wolff's claim lacks evidence, as no records confirm Trump's application to Harvard in the 1960s. This denial comes amidst escalating tensions between Trump and Harvard.
author: TOI World Desk

title: South Korea votes after a turbulent six months. Here’s what to know.
description: The election was called after President Yoon Suk Yeol was removed from office over his decision to declare martial law. Political divisions have only worsened.
author: Michelle Lee

title: Ukraine, Russia hold brief talks, agree on prisoner exchange but little else
description: The second round of talks was even shorter than the first and didn’t address any substantive issues to ending the three-year conflict.
author: Beril Eski, Mary Ilyushina, Serhiy Morgunov
